comments: I have an application deployed in JBoss 4.0.4 that has been working with BIRT reports, but the latest version of the viewer (2.2RC2) won't execute a report if the application is also deployed.  I saw a thread about a conflict being caused because of JAAS being used in the other application, but it is not an option to turn off security in our environment.  Crosstab functionality in the new release is critical, and it looks right now like it's not scheduled to be addressed until later.  Any workarounds?

I have downloaded JBoss4.0.4 and deployed BIRT on it. it worked well.
How did you integrate BIRT into your application?

We have a single 
EAR file that holds our application, and have modified the security file in the conmf directory to point to our login module (using JAAS.). The birt.war is put in the same deploy directory as the application ear.

If our ear is there (and I assume using JAAs), birt won't start.  If I remove the ear, birt works as usual.

The JAAS policy is defined in the <jboss_home>/<server>/conf/login-config.xml:

    <application-policy name = "RomeLogin">
       <authentication>
          <login-module code = "rome.security.loginModules.RomeDbLoginModule" flag = "sufficient">
		<module-option name="useShardState">true</module-option>
		<module-option name="debug">false</module-option>
          </login-module>
	  <login-module code = "rome.security.loginModules.LdapLoginModule" flag = "sufficient">
                <module-option name = "jndiProvider">
		    com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory   
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "hostUrl">
                    ldap://houtstul1.rometest.com:389
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "baseDN">
                    DC=rometest,DC=com
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "userDNPattern">
                    rometest\?
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "appendBaseDN">
                    false
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "groupFilterPattern">
                    (sameaccountname=?)
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "groupFilterAttribute">
                    memberOf
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "groupNameAttribute">
                    cn
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "useShardState">
                    true
                </module-option>
                <module-option name = "debug">
                    false
                </module-option>
	  </login-module>   
       </authentication>
    </application-policy>

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
The error in the log is below:

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 182161 ***
